subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
The major Iraq offensive aimed at driving
  al Qaeda insurgents out of safe havens is in its second day. Iraqi insurgents
  joined 10,000 U.S. troops
  in the offensive and took control of several areas north of Baghdad today. David Martin will have the
  latest.
 
And our chief foreign correspondent Lara Logan will update
  us on the orphanage story she reported on Monday. She’ll give us some
  encouraging news about how the once-neglected Baghdad orphans are doing now. 
 
Back in the United
   States, a South
    Carolina community is beginning the process of
  mourning nine firefighters who died in massive furniture factory blaze.
  Tonight, Kelly Cobiella will share the story of one man who escaped from the
  inferno. 
 
And there’s extraordinary new animation that
  shows more clearly than we’ve seen before why the World Trade
Center towers collapsed
  on 9/11 after being hit by airplanes.
 
What if a Web site could tell you that going to one
  hospital in your area rather than another could dramatically improve your
  odds of survival? Now, one has been set up by the U.S. government. Wyatt Andrews
  will give you all the details.
 
Finally, it’s been 35 years since the
  Watergate scandal drove former President Richard Nixon out of office. Now
  historians at the National Archives are poring over his speeches, gifts and
  recordings – yes, even that 18 ½ minutes of blank tape – for
  installation at the Nixon Library. Richard Schlesinger will take us inside
  the vault for a fascinating history lesson. 
 
Thanks and I hope you’ll join us tonight,
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
